name: coughing
description: A persistent or frequent cough that may be dry or produce mucus. Can range from mild irritation to severe disruption of daily activities and sleep.

name: fever
description: Elevated body temperature above normal (98.6°F/37°C), often accompanied by chills, sweating, and general discomfort. Usually indicates the body is fighting an infection.

name: sore throat
description: Pain, scratchiness, or irritation in the throat that often worsens when swallowing. May be caused by viral infections, bacterial infections, or environmental factors.

name: sores
description: Open wounds, ulcers, or lesions on the skin or mucous membranes. May be painful, slow to heal, or recurrent, potentially indicating infection or other underlying conditions.

name: rash
description: Changes in skin appearance including redness, bumps, patches, or irritation. May be itchy, painful, or cosmetically concerning, with various underlying causes including allergies or infections.

name: constipation
description: Difficulty or infrequency in bowel movements, typically fewer than three times per week. May cause abdominal discomfort, bloating, and strain during defecation.

name: weakness
description: General fatigue, lack of energy, or reduced physical strength that interferes with daily activities. May indicate underlying medical conditions requiring professional evaluation.
